intro: Lebeckia spathulifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved lebeckia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, also known as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent leaves and vibrant flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with a distinctive spathelike bract that encloses the inflorescence. Lebeckia spathulifolia is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and drought tolerance.
